attributes.action: allow for more information to be written in petitions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The 1000 characters including spaces is not space enough to explain new complex ideas and therefore will not generate informed public opinion thereby limiting the use of the petition service to some kind of excuse the government can point to as an example of their interest in public opinion perhaps. Thomas Jefferson said information is the currency of democracy. Surely then we should allow for as much information to be openly posted as possible. The servants at number 10 should then love this influx of their bread and butter. Fortunately this is a simple problem and so is the problem of greed that blinds the systems of governance. However the consequences of such problems are too complex for 1000 characters to encompass. There is no freedom, no democracy.

rejection.details: We will feed your thoughts into our process as we review how this beta testing phase has progressed. Many thanks for your thoughts.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
